response:
Subacute right hemicord syndrome is most often due to compressive thoracic lesions; inflammatory partial myelitis is the main non-compressive alternative; infection and vascular causes are less likely but must be excluded.

differential_diagnosis = ["Right thoracic intradural extramedullary meningioma", "Thoracic disc herniation with cord compression", "Multiple sclerosis with partial thoracic myelitis", "Neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder", "Metastatic epidural spinal cord compression", "Spinal epidural abscess", "Spinal dural arteriovenous fistula"]
